project.name: phidgets
project.description: A Node.js library enabling the use of various Phidgets interface boards.

phidgets.name: phidgets
phidgets.description:
The `Phidgets` library module makes it easy to connect to various sensor and controller
boards made by [Phidgets Inc.](http://www.phidgets.com) This library works under
[Node.js](http://www.nodejs.org) and other compatible frameworks such as
[io.js](http://www.iojs.org)

For support, go to the GitHub [project page](https://github.com/evantahler/nodePhidgets).

Please note that this library is an open source project that is not affiliated with
Phidgets Inc.
todo: Add support for more Phidget boards

Phidget.name: Phidget

PhidgetInterfaceKit.name: PhidgetInterfaceKit
PhidgetInterfaceKit.description:
The `PhidgetInterfaceKit` class allows you to control and receive data from all Phidget
interface kit boards :

 * PhidgetInterfaceKit 8/8/8 normal and mini-format
 * PhidgetInterfaceKit 2/2/2
 * PhidgetInterfaceKit 0/16/16
 * PhidgetInterfaceKit 8/8/8 (with and without hub)
 * etc.

Not all of these boards have been tested. If you possess one and can verify its
compatibility, let us know.

This object extends the `Phidget` object which extends Node.js' [`events.EventEmitter` object](https://nodejs.org/api/events.html#events_class_events_eventemitter).
See that object's documentation for inherited methods.

PhidgetLED.name: PhidgetLED
PhidgetLED.description:
The PhidgetLED class allows you to control a PhidgetLED-64 Advanced board.

This object extends the `Phidget` object which itself extends Node.js'
[`events.EventEmitter` object](https://nodejs.org/api/events.html#events_class_events_eventemitter).
See that object's documentation for inherited methods.

PhidgetBridge.name: PhidgetBridge

PhidgetStepper.name: PhidgetStepper

PhidgetRFID.name: PhidgetRFID

PhidgetTemperatureSensor.name: PhidgetTemperatureSensor
PhidgetTemperatureSensor.author: Andrew Berger <andrew@andrewberger.net>

classitems.description: [read-only] Array of all the devices supported by this library.
classitems.name: supportedDevices

classitems.description: [read-only] The type of device (i.e. PhidgetInterfaceKit, PhidgetLED, etc.).
classitems.name: type

classitems.description:
[read-only]  Whether the device is ready for use or not. A device must be 'opened'
before it can be used.
classitems.name: ready

classitems.description: Whether to try to automatically reopen the device if it gets remotely closed.
classitems.name: reopen

classitems.description: The host name or address of the Phidgets WebService to connect to.
classitems.name: host

classitems.description: The port of the Phidgets webservice to connect to.
classitems.name: port

classitems.description:
The unique serial number of the device. If specified, it will be used to connect to
the matching device.
classitems.name: serial

classitems.description:
The unique label of the device. The label must have a maximum length of 10
characters. If you try to set a longer label, the remainder will be truncated. Labels
are supported only on newer devices and are remembered even when the device is
unplugged. A label can only be set after a Phidget has been 'opened'. Trying to set
the label before that will fail silently.
classitems.name: label

classitems.description:
[read-only] The unique ID of the Phidget WebService the device is currently connected
to.
classitems.name: serverId

classitems.description:
The password to connect to the WebService. If specified, it will be used when opening
a new connection. As soon as connected the password property will be erased. THIS IS
CURRENTLY SET TO PRIVATE BECAUSE IT'S NOT IMPLEMENTED YET!
classitems.name: password

classitems.description:
[read-only] Human-readable version of the board's name (i.e. "Phidget InterfaceKit
8/8/8". This information is only available some time after the connection has been
successfully opened.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
[read-only] This number distinguishes between revisions of a specific type of
Phidget. It is only useful for debugging purposes. This information is only available
some time after the connection has been successfully opened.
classitems.name: version

classitems.description: The delay (in milliseconds) between report updates sent from the webservice.
classitems.name: interReportPeriod

classitems.description: This is an alias for the `on()` method.
classitems.name: addListener

params.name: event
params.description: The event to add the listener for.

params.name: listener
params.description:
The callback function to execute when the event is
triggered.

classitems.description:
Adds a listener to the end of the listeners array for the specified event. No checks
are made to see if the listener has already been added. Multiple calls passing the same
combination of event and listener will result in the listener being added multiple
times.

This method is inherited from Node.js'
[`events.EventEmitter` object](https://nodejs.org/api/events.html#events_class_events_eventemitter).
See that object's documentation for more details methods.
classitems.name: on

params.name: event
params.description: The event to add the listener for.

params.name: listener
params.description:
The callback function to execute when the event is
triggered.

classitems.description:
Adds a one time listener for the event. This listener is invoked only the next time the
event is fired, after which it is removed.

This method is inherited from Node.js'
[`events.EventEmitter` object](https://nodejs.org/api/events.html#events_class_events_eventemitter).
See that object's documentation for more details methods.
classitems.name: once

params.name: event
params.description: The event to add the listener for.

params.name: listener
params.description:
The callback function to execute when the event is
triggered.

classitems.description:
Removes all listeners, or those of the specified event.

This method is inherited from Node.js'
[`events.EventEmitter` object](https://nodejs.org/api/events.html#events_class_events_eventemitter).
See that object's documentation for more details methods.
classitems.name: removeAllListeners

params.name: event
params.description: The event to remove the listeners for.

classitems.description:
Removes a listener from the listener array for the specified event. `removeListener()`
will remove, at most, one instance of a listener from the listener array. If any single
listener has been added multiple times to the listener array for the specified event,
then `removeListener()` must be called multiple times to remove each instance.

This method is inherited from Node.js'
[`events.EventEmitter` object](https://nodejs.org/api/events.html#events_class_events_eventemitter).
See that object's documentation for more details methods.
classitems.name: removeListener

params.name: event
params.description: The event to remove the listeners for.

params.name: listener
params.description:
The callback function to execute when the event is
triggered.

classitems.description:
Opens a connection to a Phidget device. Opening a connection is a two-step process.
First, a connection to the Phidget WebService (which must be running) is established.
Then, a session to the specified device (which must be plugged in) is opened.
classitems.name: open

params.name: options
params.description: Options

props.name: host
props.description: Hostname or IP address to connect to

props.name: serial
props.description: Serial number of the device to connect to

props.name: label
props.description:
Label of the device to connect to (can be set in the
       Phidgets control panel).

return.description: Returns the Phidget to allow method chaining.

classitems.description: Event emitted when an attempt to open a Phidget has been initiated.
classitems.name: opening

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual Phidget object that emitted the event.

classitems.description: Closes a previously opened connection to a Phidget device.
classitems.name: close

return.description: Returns the Phidget to allow method chaining.

classitems.description: Event emitted when the connection to a phidget has been remotely closed.
classitems.name: closed

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual object that emitted the event.

classitems.description:
Event emitted when an attempt to automatically re-open a closed Phidget is
being carried on.
classitems.name: reopening

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual Phidget object that emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: Additional data regarding the event.

props.name: attempt
props.description: The number of re-opening attempts performed.

props.name: max
props.description:
The maximum number of attempts that will be tried before
failing.

classitems.description: Event emitted when an error occurs while trying to open a phidget
classitems.name: error

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual object that emitted the event.

params.name: error
params.description: The error object

classitems.description:
This function is called each time data is received from the Phidget WebSerice. It adds
the data to the input buffer and checks if full lines (separated by '\n') can be
reconstructed. If full lines are found they are handed over to the `_parseLineInput()`
method for processing.
classitems.name: _handleData

params.name: chunk
params.description: A chunk of utf8 encoded text to parse

classitems.description:
Event emitted when a new line of data has been received from the web service. This
is mostly useful for debugging purposes (hence the @private denomination). It will
let you view all data coming in.
classitems.name: received

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual Phidget object that emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: The actual string data received.

classitems.description:
Parses a single line of data typically received from the Phidget WebService. If the
line is a *report* line, the function hands it off to the `_parsePskKey()` method.
Otherwise, it deals with it locally.
classitems.name: _parseLineInput

params.name: line
params.description: A non-terminated line of utf8 text

classitems.description: Event emitted when a phidget is successfully opened.
classitems.name: opened

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual Phidget object that emitted the event.

classitems.description: Event emitted when an attempt to open a Phidget times out.
classitems.name: timeout

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual Phidget object that emitted the event.

classitems.description: Parses a /PSK string and performs appropriate action.

params.name: oPsk
params.description: Original /PSK string typically coming from the Phidget WebService

classitems.description:
Parses Phidget-specific data received from the Phidget WebService. This function is
meant to be overridden by subclasses.
classitems.name: _parsePhidgetSpecificData

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the received data

props.name: device
props.description:
The device identifier (e.g. PhidgetInterfaceKey,
       PhidgetLED, etc.).

props.name: label
props.description: The custom label set for the device.

props.name: serial
props.description: The serial number of the device.

props.name: keyword
props.description:
A keyword identifying the type of information conveyed. It
       could be 'Input', 'Version', 'DataRate', etc.

props.name: index
props.description: The numerical index (for indexed keys only)

props.name: status
props.description:
The status of the key. It could be: 'added', 'changed',
       'removing', etc.

classitems.description:
Sets phidget-specific state before the 'opened' event is triggered. This is a good
place for subclasses to assign initial values to the board. This is meant to be
overridden by subclasses.
classitems.name: _setPhidgetSpecificInitialState

classitems.description:
Returns a /PCK string built from the specified parameters. PCK strings are the keys
sent out to control the board.
classitems.name: _makePckString

params.name: keyword
params.description: The operation keyword to use

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the output to use

classitems.description: Sends the /PCK string (with attached value) to the webservice.
classitems.name: _sendPck

params.name: key
params.description: A /PCK string (typically form the _makePckString() method)

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set

params.name: persistent
params.description:
Whether the value should persist or whether its for
       the session only.

classitems.description: Sends a line of data to the webservice
classitems.name: _sendLine

params.name: line
params.description: A non-terminated line of data to send

classitems.description:
Event emitted when a new line of data has been sent to the Phidget WebService. This
is mostly useful for debugging purposes (hence the @private denomination). It will
let you view all data going out.
classitems.name: sent

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual Phidget object that emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: The actual string of sent data.

classitems.description: Returns the value after making sure it falls between min and max.
classitems.name: _forceBetween

params.name: value
params.description: The value to check

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum value desired

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum value desired

return.description: int

classitems.description:
[read-only] An object containing information about the digital inputs of the device.
Here are a few examples of how to retrieve information in that object:

    PhidgetInterfaceKit.inputs[5].value         // Input 5 current value
    PhidgetInterfaceKit.inputs.count            // Total number of inputs on the device
classitems.name: inputs

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The total number of inputs on the device.

subprops.name: inputs[int].value
subprops.description: The current value of the specified input.

classitems.description:
[read-only] An object containing information about the analog sensor inputs of the
device. Here are a few examples of how to retrieve information in that object:

    PhidgetInterfaceKit.sensors[5].value         // Sensor 5 current value
    PhidgetInterfaceKit.sensors.count            // Total number of sensors on the device
    PhidgetInterfaceKit.sensors[3].sensitivity   // Sensor 3 sensitivity level
classitems.name: sensors

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The total number of sensors on the device.

subprops.name: sensors[int].rawValue
subprops.description: The current raw value of the specified sensor.

subprops.name: sensors[int].sensitivity
subprops.description:
The sensitivity threshold of the specified
          sensor.

subprops.name: sensors[int].updateInterval
subprops.description:
The update interval of the specified
          sensor.

subprops.name: sensors[int].value
subprops.description: The current value of the specified sensor.

classitems.description:
[read-only] An object containing information about the digital outputs of the device.
Here are a few examples of how to retrieve information in that object:

    PhidgetInterfaceKit.outputs[5].value     // Output 5 current value
    PhidgetInterfaceKit.outputs.count        // Total number of outputs on the device
classitems.name: outputs

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The total number of outputs on the device.

subprops.name: outputs[int].value
subprops.description: The current value of the specified output.

classitems.description:
Determines whether ratiometric values should be used or not for analog sensors. If
this property is defined before the phidget is opened, it will be set as soon as
possible after opening it. If it is defined after the board is opened and ready, it
will be set right away.
classitems.name: ratiometric

classitems.description:
Sets the specified output to active (true) or inactive (false). This method should only
be used after the board is 'opened'. Calling it before will fail silently.
classitems.name: setOutput

params.name: index
params.description: The output number to set (or array of output numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The value you wish to set the output to.

return.description:
Returns the PhidgetInterfaceKit to allow method
         chaining.

classitems.description: Event emitted when an output's status is changed.
classitems.name: output

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetInterfaceKit object that
       emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the output data and related information

classitems.description:
Sets the update interval of a sensor. The update interval is the number of
milliseconds between update notifications. It must be a multiple of 8 between 8 and
1000.

The shorter the interval is and the more frequent the updates will be. However, shorter
intervals are more demanding on the cpu. This function accepts a single sensor number
or an array of sensor numbers to set. This method should only be used after the board
is 'opened'. Calling it before will fail silently.
classitems.name: setUpdateInterval

params.name: index
params.description: The sensor's number (or an array of sensor numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The number of milliseconds you wish to set the interval to.

return.description:
Returns the PhidgetInterfaceKit to allow method
         chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets the sensitivity threshold of a sensor. The threshold is measured in `sensorvalue`
(0-1000). It is the smallest change that will trigger an update notification from the
sensor. Sensitivity threshold and update intervals are mutually exclusive. If you set
the sensitivity of a sensor, the update interval will be ignored and vice versa.

This function accepts a single sensor number or an array of sensor numbers for which to
set the sensitivity.

This method should only be used after the board is 'opened'. Calling it before will
fail silently.
classitems.name: setSensitivity

params.name: index
params.description: The sensor's number (or an array of sensor numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The number sensitivity threshold to assign (0-1000)

return.description:
Returns the PhidgetInterfaceKit to allow method
         chaining.

classitems.description: Event emitted when the status of a binary input changes.
classitems.name: input

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetInterfaceKit object that
       emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the input data and related information

classitems.description: Event emitted when analog sensor data is received
classitems.name: sensor

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetInterfaceKit object that
       emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the sensor data and related information

classitems.description:
[read-only] An object containing information about all LED outputs of the device.
Here are a few examples of how to retrieve information in that object:

    PhidgetLED.leds[5].value     // LED 5 current value
    PhidgetLED.leds.count        // Total number of LED outputs on the device
classitems.name: leds

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The total number of physical LED outputs on the device.

subprops.name: leds[int].value
subprops.description:
The current brightness value of the specified LED
          output (between 0 and 100)

subprops.name: leds[int].currentLimit
subprops.description:
The current limit of the specified LED output
          (in mA).

classitems.description:
The global voltage for all led outputs. When setting the voltage, you must use one of
the values in the `PhidgetLED.supportedVoltages` array. Valid values currently are
(in volts):

* 1.7
* 2.75
* 3.9
* 5

Trying to set the voltage to another value will fail silently. This is not supported
by all PhidgetLED boards.
classitems.name: voltage

classitems.description:
The global "current limit" for all led outputs. When setting the global current
limit, you must use one of the values in the
`PhidgetLED.supportedGlobalCurrentLimits` array. Valid values currently are (in mA):
20, 40, 60, 80. Trying to set the current limit to another value will fail silently.

This is not supported by all PhidgetLED boards.
classitems.name: currentLimit

classitems.description: [read-only] Array of supported voltages (in volts).
classitems.name: supportedVoltages

classitems.description:
[read-only] An array of values that are valid when setting the global current limit
(in mA).
classitems.name: supportedGlobalCurrentLimits

classitems.description: Adjusts the brightness of a LED.
classitems.name: setBrightness

params.name: index
params.description:
The LED output number for which to adjust the brightness (or
       array of LED output numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The value (0-100) you wish to adjust the brightness to.

return.description: Returns the Phidget to allow method chaining

classitems.description: Event emitted right after a LED's brightness has been changed.
classitems.name: brightness

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetInterfaceKit object that
       emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description:
An object containing the brightness data and related
       information

classitems.description:
Sets the current limit (in mA) for a specific LED output (or an array of LED outputs).
The value must be between 0 and 80 mA. If the value provided is outside this range, the
closest acceptable value will be used instead.
classitems.name: setCurrentLimit

params.name: index
params.description:
The LED output number (or array of LED output numbers) for
       which to adjust the current limit

params.name: value
params.description:
The value you wish to adjust the current limit to. Should be within
       the range defined by `PhidgetLED.currentLimitRange`.

return.description: Returns the Phidget to allow method chaining

classitems.description:
[read-only] An object containing information about all the bridge's sensors. Here are
a few examples of how to retrieve information in that object:

    PhidgetBridge.sensors[2].value         // Sensor 2 current value
    PhidgetBridge.sensors.count            // Total number of sensors on the device
    PhidgetBridge.sensors[3].gain          // Sensor 3 sensitivity level
    PhidgetBridge.sensors[0].enabled       // Whether sensor 0 is currently enabled
classitems.name: sensors

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The total number of sensors on the device.

subprops.name: sensors[int].gain
subprops.description: The gain for this sensor (1, 8, 16, 32, 64 or 128)

subprops.name: sensors[int].updateInterval
subprops.description:
The update interval of the specified
          sensor.

subprops.name: sensors[int].value
subprops.description:
The current value of the specified sensor in
                                       mV/V. If the sensor is not enabled, this will
                                       be `null`.

subprops.name: sensors[int].min
subprops.description:
The minimum value that the sensor can measure
                                       in mV/V. This value will depend on the
                                       selected gain. At a gain of 1, the maximum is
                                       -1000mV/V.

subprops.name: sensors[int].max
subprops.description:
The minimum value that the sensor can measure
                                       in mV/V. This value will depend on the
                                       selected gain. At a gain of 1, the maximum is
                                       1000mV/V.

classitems.description:
The duration (in milliseconds) between update notifications (must be multiple of 8).
The shorter the interval is, the more frequent the updates will be sent by the
device.
classitems.name: updateInterval

classitems.description:
Sets the gain of a specific sensor (or array of sensors). Valid values are 1, 8, 16,
32, 64 or 128. The highest the gain, the better the resolution. For that reason, its
best to use the highest gain possible that can still measure the full range of your
sensor.
classitems.name: setGain

params.name: index
params.description: The sensor's number (or an array of sensor numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The gain to assign (1, 8, 16, 32, 64 or 128)

return.description: Returns the PhidgetBridge to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
Enables or disables a sensor. Beware that this setting remains even when the bridge is
 powered off.
classitems.name: setEnabled

params.name: index
params.description: The sensor's number (or an array of sensor numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The status to set

return.description: Returns the PhidgetBridge to allow method chaining.

classitems.description: Event emitted when sensor data is received.
classitems.name: sensor

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetBridge object that emitted the
event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the sensor data and related information

classitems.description:
The duration (in milliseconds) between update notifications (must be multiple of 8).
The shorter the interval is, the more frequent the updates will be sent by the
device.
classitems.name: updateInterval

classitems.description: [Read-only] The minimum acceleration value that can be set on outputs
classitems.name: minimumAcceleration

classitems.description: [Read-only] The maximum acceleration value that can be set on outputs
classitems.name: maximumAcceleration

classitems.description: [Read-only] The minimum position that an output can travel to.
classitems.name: minimumPosition

classitems.description: [Read-only] The maximum position that an output can travel to.
classitems.name: maximumPosition

classitems.description: [Read-only] The minimum velocity that an output can be set to.
classitems.name: minimumVelocity

classitems.description: [Read-only] The maximum velocity that an output can be set to.
classitems.name: maximumVelocity

classitems.description:
[Read-only] The minimum current that an output can be set to. Current limits are not
supported by all stepper controllers.
classitems.name: minimumCurrent

classitems.description:
[Read-only] The maximum current that an output can be set to. Current limits are not
supported by all stepper controllers.
classitems.name: maximumCurrent

classitems.description:
[read-only] An object containing information about the motor outputs of the device.
Here are a few examples of how to retrieve information in that object:

    PhidgetStepper.outputs[5].currentPosition  // Motor 5's current position
    PhidgetStepper.outputs[5].stopped          // Is motor 5 stopped?
    PhidgetStepper.outputs.count               // Total number of outputs on the device
classitems.name: outputs

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The total number of outputs on the device.

subprops.name: outputs[int].position
subprops.description:
The position of the motor hooked up to that
output. This value remains between sessions. It is used when calculating the movement
needed to reach the target position. It can be manually set with `setPosition()`.

subprops.name: outputs[int].targetPosition
subprops.description: The last set target position.

subprops.name: outputs[int].acceleration
subprops.description:
The last set acceleration value (also
used as deceleration value). This property should be set as part of initialization
because otherwise, it will remain unknown.

subprops.name: outputs[int].currentLimit
subprops.description:
The last set current limit. Current
limit is not supported by all stepper controllers.

subprops.name: outputs[int].current
subprops.description:
The actual current draw for the motor
connected to that output. Current sense is not supported by all stepper controllers.

subprops.name: outputs[int].targetVelocity
subprops.description:
The desired velocity (speed) for the
motor on that output. Sometimes referred to as the "velocity limit".

subprops.name: outputs[int].velocity
subprops.description:
The actual current velocity for the motor
on that output.

subprops.name: outputs[int].engaged
subprops.description:
The engaged state. This is whether or not
the motor connected to the output is currently powered.

subprops.name: outputs[int].stopped
subprops.description:
Whether the motor connected to that output
is currently stopped. If this is true, it indicates that the motor is not moving, and
there are no outstanding commands.

classitems.description:
[read-only] An object containing information about the digital inputs of the
PhidgetStepper board. If `PhidgetStepper.inputs.count` equals 0, it simply means that
your board does not have any digital inputs.

    PhidgetStepper.inputs[0].value  // Digital input 0's boolean value
    PhidgetStepper.outputs.count    // Number of digital inputs on the device
classitems.name: inputs

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The total number of digital inputs on the device.

subprops.name: outputs[int].value
subprops.description: The current boolean value of the input.

classitems.description:
Starts or stops power from being sent to the motor connected to a specific output (or
array of outputs). By default, outputs do not power connected motors. Before moving
the motor, you must therefore engage the motor first.

To reduce the motor's power consumption, you can disengage it once it's reached its
target position. If you are concerned about keeping accurate track of position, the
motor should not be disengaged until the motor is stopped.
classitems.name: engageMotor

params.name: index
params.description: The motor's index number (or an array of motor numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The boolean status to use.

return.description: Returns the PhidgetStepper object to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets the acceleration for the motor connected to the specified output. The motor will
both accelerate and decelarate at this rate. For the 1062 board, this is specified in
half-steps.

The minimum and maximum acceleration values can be viewed in the `minimumAcceleration`
and `maximumAcceleration` properties.

The acceleration should be explicitely set as part of initialization because otherwise
it will remain unknown.
classitems.name: setAcceleration

params.name: index
params.description: The output's index number (or an array of output numbers)

params.name: value
params.description:
The desired acceleration specified in half-steps. If not
specified (or invalid), the maximum acceleration will be used.

return.description: Returns the PhidgetStepper to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets the target speed (velocity) for the motor connected to the specified output (or
array of outputs). If the `targetVelocity` is set to 0, the motor will not move.

Note that this is not necessarily the speed that the motor is being turned at. The
motor is accelerated towards the target velocity and then decelerated as it approaches
the target position. If the target position is close enough, it may never reach the
target velocity.
classitems.name: setTargetVelocity

params.name: index
params.description: The output's index number (or an array of output numbers)

params.name: value
params.description:
The desired velocity specified in half-steps. If not specified
(or invalid), the maximum velocity will be used.

return.description: Returns the PhidgetStepper to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets the current position of the motor connected to the specified output (or array of
outputs). Setting the position does not actually move the motor, it merely sets the
reference that will be used when moving to a target position.
classitems.name: setPosition

params.name: index
params.description: The output's index number (or an array of output numbers).

params.name: value
params.description:
The desired velocity specified in half-steps. If not specified
(or invalid), the maximum velocity will be used.

return.description: Returns the PhidgetStepper to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets a new target position for the motor connected to the specified output. The motor
will immediately start moving towards this position.

Note that calling `setTargetPosition()` will override a previous call to
`setTargetPosition()` and the motor will begin tracking to the new position
immediately. The velocity of the motor will be ramped appropriately.
classitems.name: setTargetPosition

params.name: index
params.description: The output's index number (or an array of output numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The target position specified in half-steps.

return.description: Returns the PhidgetStepper to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets the upper current limit for the motor connected to the specified output. Note that
not all stepper controllers support current limiting.
classitems.name: setCurrentLimit

params.name: index
params.description: The output's index number (or an array of output numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The target position specified in half-steps.

return.description: Returns the PhidgetStepper to allow method chaining.

classitems.description: Event emitted when digital input data is received.
classitems.name: input

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetStepper object that emitted the
event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the input data and related information

classitems.description:
Event emitted to report that the position of a motor connected to one of the
board's outputs has changed.
classitems.name: position

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetStepper object that emitted the
event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing information about the event.

classitems.description:
Event emitted when a motor connected to one of the board's outputs has reached
its target position.
classitems.name: target

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetStepper object that emitted the
event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing information about the event.

classitems.description: Event emitted when a motor connected to one of the board's outputs starts moving.
classitems.name: start

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetStepper object that emitted the
event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing information about the event.

classitems.description: Event emitted when a motor connected to one of the board's outputs stops moving.
classitems.name: stop

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetStepper object that emitted the
event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing information about the event.

classitems.description: [read-only] Array of all protocols supported by the device.
classitems.name: SUPPORTED_PROTOCOLS

classitems.description:
[read-only] An object containing information about the digital outputs of the device.
Output 0 is also labeled on the board as "+5V". Output 1 is also labeled on the board
as "LED". This is not to be confused with the onboard LED. To control the onboard
LED, please use the `PhidgetRFID.led` property.

Here is how to retrieve an output's value or the total number of outputs:

    PhidgetRFID.outputs[1].value     // Output 1 current value
    PhidgetRFID.outputs.count        // Total number of outputs on the device
classitems.name: outputs

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The total number of outputs on the device.

subprops.name: outputs[int].value
subprops.description: The current value of the specified output.

classitems.description:
[read-only] Status of the reader. The two possible statuses are:

  - waiting: no tag is being detected because none are present or because the antenna is off
  - detecting: a tag is currently being detected
classitems.name: status

classitems.description: [read-only] An object containing information about the last tag that was read.
classitems.name: tag

subprops.name: value
subprops.description: The tag's value.

subprops.name: protocol
subprops.description: The tag's protocol.

subprops.name: detectedAt
subprops.description: A `Date` object representing the moment when the tag was read.

subprops.name: lostAt
subprops.description:
A `Date` object representing the moment when the previously read
tag was lost.

classitems.description:
The status of the onboard LED (not to be confused with the LED output). Setting this
property to `true` will turn on the onboard LED while setting it to `false` will turn it
off.
classitems.name: led

classitems.description:
The activity status of the RFID antenna. The antenna must be activated in order for
the device to work properly. Setting this property to `true` activates the antenna
while setting it to `false` deactivates it.
classitems.name: antenna

classitems.description: Event emitted when a tag has been detected.
classitems.name: detected

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual PhidgetRFID object that emitted the event.

props.name: protocol
props.description:
The tag's protocol. Supported protocols are: `ISO11785 FDX-B`,
`EM4100` and `PhidgetTag`.

props.name: detectedAt
props.description: The date and time when the tag was detected.

props.name: lostAt
props.description: The date and time when the tag was lost.

classitems.description: Event emitted when a previously detected tag is now lost
classitems.name: lost

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual PhidgetRFID object that emitted the event.

props.name: protocol
props.description:
The tag's protocol. Supported protocols are: `ISO11785 FDX-B`,
`EM4100` and `PhidgetTag`.

props.name: detectedAt
props.description: The date and time when the tag was detected.

props.name: lostAt
props.description: The date and time when the tag was lost.

classitems.description: Event emitted when the device's status changes.
classitems.name: status

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual PhidgetRFID object that emitted the event.

params.name: status
params.description: Status of the device (`detecting` or `waiting`).

classitems.description: Event emitted when the antenna's status changes.
classitems.name: antenna

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual PhidgetRFID object that emitted the event.

params.name: status
params.description:
Status of the antenna. `true` means it is now "on" and `false` means
it is now "off".

classitems.description: Event emitted when the onboard LED's status changes.
classitems.name: led

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual PhidgetRFID object that emitted the event.

params.name: status
params.description:
Status of the LED. `true` means it is now "on" and `false` means it is
now "off".

classitems.description: Event emitted when an output's status has changed.
classitems.name: output

params.name: emitter
params.description: The actual PhidgetRFID object that emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the output data and related information

classitems.description:
Sets the specified output to active (`true`) or inactive (`false`). This method should only
be used after the board is 'opened'. Calling it before will fail silently.
classitems.name: setOutput

params.name: index
params.description: The output number to set (or array of output numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The value you wish to set the output to.

return.description: Returns the `PhidgetRFID` object to allow method chaining.

classitems.description: Writes a tag. Please note that not all devices have write capacity. This method will be silently
classitems.name: write

params.name: tag
params.description: The value that should be written to the card.

params.name: protocol
params.description:
An integer identifying the protocol to be used. 1 is EM4100, 2 is
ISO11785 FDX-B and 3 is PhidgetTag. Default is EM4100.

params.name: lock
params.description:
Whether the card should be prevented from being written again.
Default is false.

return.description: Returns the `PhidgetRFID` object to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
[read-only] The last known ambient temperature of the sensor (where the inputs connect to the
board), in degrees celsius.
classitems.name: ambientTemperature

classitems.description:
[read-only] The highest possible ambient temperature value which can be returned by the sensor,
in degrees celsius.
classitems.name: ambientTemperatureMax

classitems.description:
[read-only] The lowest possible ambient temperature value which can be returned by the sensor,
in degrees celsius.
classitems.name: ambientTemperatureMin

classitems.description: [read-only] An object containing data about each input on the device.
classitems.name: inputs

subprops.name: count
subprops.description: The number of inputs available on the device.

subprops.name: inputs[int].temperature
subprops.description:
The input's last known temperature in degrees
celsius.

subprops.name: inputs[int].temperatureMax
subprops.description:
The highest temperature possible for the given
input, based on thermocouple type.

subprops.name: inputs[int].temperatureMin
subprops.description:
The lowest temperature possible for the given
input, based on thermocouple type.

subprops.name: inputs[int].trigger
subprops.description:
The input's temperature change trigger, in
degrees celsius.

subprops.name: inputs[int].potential
subprops.description: The input's last known voltage.

subprops.name: inputs[int].potentialMax
subprops.description:
The highest voltage possible for the given input,
based on thermocouple type.

subprops.name: inputs[int].potentialMin
subprops.description:
The lowest voltage possible for the given input,
based on thermocouple type.

subprops.name: inputs[int].thermocoupleType
subprops.description:
The type of thermocouple attached to the given
input. Value corresponds to a value from PhidgetTemperatureSensor.THERMOCOUPLE_TYPES.

classitems.description:
[read-only] An enum of supported thermocouple types. Support for other thermocouple types, and
voltage sources other than thermocouples in the valid range (between potentialMin and
potentialMax) can be achieved using potential.
classitems.name: THERMOCOUPLE_TYPES

subprops.name: TYPE_K
subprops.description: Integer value represent a K-type thermocouple.

subprops.name: TYPE_J
subprops.description: Integer value represent a J-type thermocouple.

subprops.name: TYPE_E
subprops.description: Integer value represent a E-type thermocouple.

subprops.name: TYPE_T
subprops.description: Integer value represent a T-type thermocouple.

classitems.description:
Sets the change trigger for an input. This is the amount by which the sensed temperature must
change between temperature change events. By default this is set to 0.5. Setting trigger
to 0 will cause all temperature updates to fire events. This is helpful for applications that are
implementing their own filtering.
classitems.name: setTemperatureChangeTrigger

params.name: index
params.description: The input's number (or an array of input numbers)

params.name: value
params.description: The TemperatureChangeTigger value to set

return.description:
Returns the PhidgetTemperatureSensor to allow method
chaining.

classitems.description:
Sets the thermocouple type for an input. The possible values are 'J', 'K', 'E', and 'T', or one
of the values in the PhidgetTemperatureSensor.THERMOCOUPLE_TYPES enum. Support for other
thermocouple types, and voltage sources other than thermocouples in the valid range (between
potentialMin and potentialMax) can be achieved using potential.
classitems.name: setThermocoupleType

params.name: index
params.description: The input's index (or an array of input indices)

params.name: value
params.description: The ThermocoupleType to set

return.description:
Returns the PhidgetTemperatureSensor to allow method
chaining.

classitems.description: The sensor's ambient temperature has changed.
classitems.name: ambientTemperature

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetTemperatureSensor object that
emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the sensor data and related information

classitems.description:
The calculated temperature of the given input has changed by more than
temperatureChangeTrigger. This value is dependent on the sensor's ambient temperature, the
input's thermocouple type, and the input's potential.
classitems.name: temperature

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetTemperatureSensor object that
emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the sensor data and related information

classitems.description: The potential (voltage) of the given input has changed.
classitems.name: potential

params.name: emitter
params.description:
The actual PhidgetTemperatureSensor object that
emitted the event.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the sensor data and related information
